Package com.cafean.client.analysis

Class Connection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cafean.client.analysis.GenericObject
      • com.cafean.client.analysis.AbstractComponent
        • com.cafean.client.analysis.Connection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Checkable, ComponentElement, IdentHolder, ModelElement, java.lang.Cloneable, javax.swing.undo.StateEditable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConnectionBean
    public abstract class Connection
extends AbstractComponent
    A class representing a connection between two components in an AbstractModel. The two sides are referred to as left and right and have their idents stored in the Connection.

    ConnectionData objects are used to describe each side and can be used, for instance, to determine which ConnectingPt in a DrawnComponent corresponds to a given Connection, or passed to AbstractComponent.connectTo(com.cafean.client.analysis.AbstractComponent, com.cafean.client.analysis.ConnectionData, com.cafean.client.analysis.ConnectionData) to describe the desired Connection.

    The convenience methods getThisSideData(com.cafean.client.analysis.AbstractComponent), getOtherSide(com.cafean.client.analysis.AbstractComponent) and getOtherSideData(com.cafean.client.analysis.AbstractComponent) have been provided to simplify Connection related code.

    Note: This class should not be directly extended by SNAP plug-ins. Extend ConnectionBean instead.

    See Also:
    DrawnComponent.createConnectionPt(double, double, double, int, int, int, int, com.cafean.client.analysis.ConnectionData)

    • Method Detail

      • getLeftConnectData

        public abstract ConnectionData getLeftConnectData()
        Retrieves a ConnectionData object describing the connection to the component on the left of this connection. This is not a persistent data structure. Each call to this method will return a new ConnectionData object. Among other uses, this method is used to identify the connection points in a DrawnComponent where this connection should attach.
        Returns:
        a new ConnectionData representing the source of the connection.

      • getRightConnectData

        public abstract ConnectionData getRightConnectData()
        Retrieves a ConnectionData object describing the connection to the component on the right of this connection.This is not a persistent data structure. Each call to this method will return a new ConnectionData object. Among other uses, this method is used to identify the connection points in a DrawnComponent where this connection should attach.
        Returns:
        a new ConnectionData representing the target of the connection.

      • isIndependentComponent

        public boolean isIndependentComponent()
        Returns true if this Connection can exists without it's left and right components.

        Non-Independent connections are deleted if and when their surrounding components are no longer available. Most connections should return false for this method.

        Returns:
        false by default.

      • getFlowDirection

        public Connection.Direction getFlowDirection()
        Returns the direction of flow/transmission/etc. that should be displayed for this connection in any rendering logic.

        The default implementation returns Connection.Direction.None.

        Returns:
        the Direction to display

      • getOtherSide

        public AbstractComponent getOtherSide​(AbstractComponent component)
        Retrieves the component that is on the other side of this Connection. If the given component is the left, this returns the right and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        component - the reference component.
        Returns:
        component the AbstractComponent that is the other side of this Connection or null if there is no other side.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given AbstractComponent is neither side of this Connection.

      • getOtherSideData

        public ConnectionData getOtherSideData​(AbstractComponent component)
        Retrieves the ConnectionData for the other side of this Connection. If the given component is the left, this returns the right and vice versa.
        Parameters:
        component - the AbstractComponent that is the other side of this Connection.
        Returns:
        the ConnectionData on the other side of this connection from the provided component.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given AbstractComponent is neither side of this Connection.

      • getThisSideData

        public ConnectionData getThisSideData​(AbstractComponent component)
        Retrieves the ConnectionData for this side of this Connection.
        Parameters:
        component - the AbstractComponent that is the desired side of this Connection.
        Returns:
        the ConnectionData from the same side as the provided component.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given AbstractComponent is neither side of this Connection.

      • getCategory

        public Category getCategory()
        Retrieves the most narrow category that this component is a member of. This should be a static reference defined in the plug-in model extension. NOTE: This is the Category of the Connection class and has no relevance to the components it connects. This should be overriden by plug-in extensions to return the appropriate child category to CAT_CONNECTION.
        Specified by:
        getCategory in class AbstractComponent
        Returns:
        AbstractModel#CAT_CONNECTION

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Description copied from class: AbstractComponent
        The default String is the form of AbstractComponent.label() GenericObject.getCCnumber() (AbstractComponent.getName()). e.g.: "Pipe 100 (sample Pipe)"
        Overrides:
        toString in class AbstractComponent
        Returns:
        the String representation of this component. This is not guaranteed to be unique in a model.

        See Also:

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects this Connection between two AbstractComponent objects.

        Removes this connection from both components and from the model. Fires all appropriate events to notify the Navigator, views and other listeners.

        Handlers for user interactive disconnection should use userDisconnect() instead.

      • userDisconnect

        public void userDisconnect()
        Disconnects the connection from the Navigator. This is the method called when a connection is disconnected from the Navigator or from one of this Connection's DrawnConnect renderers.

      • userDisconnect

        public void userDisconnect​(javax.swing.undo.CompoundEdit edit)
        This method should be overridden if the extending connection makes additional changes to either side of the connection when disconnected. For example, the boundary conditions in a TRACE heat structure are reset to Adiabatic when a Heat Connection is disconnected by the user.
        Parameters:
        edit - the CompoundEdit that will contain any additional modifications made when disconnecting a connection.

      • reconnectIdentReferences

        public void reconnectIdentReferences​(boolean preserveUnresolved,
                                     boolean useDbId)
        Description copied from class: GenericObject
        Resets this component's internal ident references to refer to appropriate components in the current AbstractModel. Intended for use after adding a component to a model and thus it's DB_ID will have been set to it's ident in the previous model. For ident references use find__ByDbId to find the new component, then store it's ident.

        Note: If this component's DB_ID is 0 this method does nothing.

        Specified by:
        reconnectIdentReferences in interface IdentHolder
        Overrides:
        reconnectIdentReferences in class AbstractComponent
        Parameters:
        preserveUnresolved - if true, ident references that aren't resolvable will be left dangling, if false, they will be set to 0.
        useDbId - if true, ident references will be reconnected via find_x_ByDB_ID; if false, ident references will be reconnected via find_x_ByIdent

      • label

        public java.lang.String label()
        Description copied from class: AbstractComponent
        Returns a String suitable for describing the component type in the Navigator, a dialog title, or the display string.

        This default implementation returns the short name of the components category, or the class name if there is no category.

        Overrides:
        label in class AbstractComponent
        Returns:
        the label text for this component.

      • isVisual

        public boolean isVisual()
        Returns true if this connection should be visually represented. Visually represented means that this Connection will have DrawnConnection objects created for it if both sides of the Connection are present in a view.

      • isEqualTo

        public boolean isEqualTo​(Connection con)
        This determines if the Connection passed in is the equivalent of this Connection. Used instead of GenericObject.equals(java.lang.Object) to allow multiple equivalent connections between two components.
        Parameters:
        con - the Connection to compare against.
        Returns:
        true if both sides of each connection are the same.

        Creates a DrawnConnection to render this Connection.
        Overrides:
        createDrawnComponent in class AbstractComponent
        Returns:
        a DrawnConnection for this Connection.

        the Color to use for this connection.

      • getConnectionStroke

        public java.awt.Stroke getConnectionStroke()
        Returns the Stroke used to paint this connection in a View. By default this uses BasicStroke
        Returns:
        the java.awt.Stroke for painting this connection.

        public java.util.Vector getCustomPopupItems()
        Creates Custom Menu Items for any popup dialog involving this component
        Overrides:
        getCustomPopupItems in class AbstractComponent
        Returns:
        a Vector of Action objects for this Connection.

      • performDisconnect

        public javax.swing.undo.UndoableEdit performDisconnect()
        This method builds an UndoableEdit that will handle disconnecting and reconnecting this connection. Overriding this method will allow a plug-in connection to perform custom operations when disconnecting or reconnecting.
        Returns:
        an UndoableEdit that has already had end called on it.

      • hasReferenceTo

        public boolean hasReferenceTo​(Category cat,
                              int ident)
        Description copied from class: AbstractComponent
        This method returns TRUE if this component contains a foreign key reference to another component that matches the given category and ident. By default this method returns false, and should be implemented as part of supporting find component reference on Abstract Model.
        Overrides:
        hasReferenceTo in class AbstractComponent
        Parameters:
        cat - the Category of component.
        ident - the primary key of the referenced component.
        Returns:
        true if this component contains a foreign key reference to the indicated component.
        See Also:
        AbstractModel.findComponentReferences(com.cafean.client.analysis.AbstractComponent), AbstractModel.canFindComponentReferences(com.cafean.client.analysis.Category)
